forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock gently marks the early hours of Wednesday morning in Downtown San Francisco, a veil of clouds lingers in the air, hinting at the city's dynamic relationship with the coastal fog. The current chill, hovering around fifty-one degrees, wraps around you like a soft shawl, urging you to consider a layer or two before you step outside. The winds whisper gently from the southwest, barely rustling the leaves, setting the stage for a gradual transition into a day that promises more than its cloudy beginning suggests.

Come midday, expect the sun to peek through with warmth and clarity, unfurling bright patches across the sky. Anticipate a high near sixty-five, though the afternoon will mellow to a gentle sixty-two as the city breathes in the soft embrace of the cooling breeze. The marine layer, though less oppressive than earlier, still paints the backdrop toward the bay, lending a delicate mystique to the iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge. Today invites you to wander through the local parks, perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero, where the sunlight dances on the water’s surface, or to find a cozy café where you can sip your morning brew and watch the world go by. Dress in light layers—a breezy top with a cardigan or jacket—so you can transition smoothly from the cool morning into the delightful embrace of the sun's radiance, capturing the essence of a beautiful San Francisco day unfolding before you.
